general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed the new commissioner, Shant Chakarian, and encouraged him to introduce himself and his interests in sustainability.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Chakarian
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed pleasure at joining the committee. He introduced himself as a former engineer and current attorney specializing in intellectual property. He has experience with inventions and technologies related to alternative fuels, sustainability, and other technologies aimed at creating a more sustainable and environmentally friendly world. As a Glendale resident of over ten years, he is excited to contribute to the city's sustainability goals.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Thanked Commissioner Chakarian and welcomed him again.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Welcomed the new Commissioner.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about the process for submitting a comment letter introduced by former Commissioner Alec, asking if a draft should be brought to a prior meeting for consideration.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed that the letter regarding drive-throughs was submitted to the city manager and likely provided to the council, but clarified the need to agenda any subsequent letter.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Clarified his original question.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed any such action needs to be agendized.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed a desire to agendize a letter concerning outreach to the community, with topics such as speaker series and field trips, and will bring a draft to the next meeting.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Asked for clarification, confirming the proposal involves the commission taking a stance on outreach efforts.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed, noting the need to coordinate with three David's office and make interested members available.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Indicated they would determine if council permission is required and would bring recommendations to the next meeting.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Seconded agendizing that item.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Noted the state of California officially banned Styrofoam food ware, despite ongoing bill reviews, and pointed out local stores might still be selling them.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Asked to confirm that statewide ban is effective immediately.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Affirmed its immediate statewide effect.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Clarified EPS refers to expanded polystyrene.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed EPS applies only to food ware, not other EPS products.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Announced an upcoming prom-themed clothing swap on May 10th at the Glendale Central Library Teen Center, promoted through social media.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Mentioned the Earth Day Fair, stating it was another part of the student commissioner projects that has now passed and would be discussed later.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Asked the Student Commissioner to share more about the clothing swap.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Explained the clothing swap is geared towards teens to teach sustainable practices through an accessible event during prom season, providing an alternative to buying dresses.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Recognized the plan.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Suggested promoting anti-fast fashion at the swap, due to clothing often being thrown out after a short amount of time.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Verified part of their plan is to educate against fast fashion. A tailor would be at the event and will provide tailoring for students needing adjustments.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Student Commissioner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: A photo booth will be at the event and makeup consultations. And goodie bags would be given out.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Commended the work.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged the headwinds facing sustainability efforts at all levels and commended the fellow commissioners and city staff for their work.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Wished former Sustainability Commissioner Alec Bartrassof good luck on his new Transportation Commission. He was an original commissioner and is missed.

general_commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
general_commissioner_comments.comment: Hoped Alec would speak as needed.

agenda_items.title: One. City Report Regarding Posting of the Agenda
agenda_items.summary: The agenda for the May 1, 2025, meeting of the Sustainability Commission was posted April 25, 2025, on the bulletin board outside City Hall.

agenda_items.title: Two. Approval of Minutes, 2A Approval of the Minutes of the Commission Regular Meeting Held February 6, 2025

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Chakarian
commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged reviewing the minutes and stated his approval.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Recommended abstaining from the vote, because they didn't watch the tape of the meeting.

agenda_items.title: Five. Action Items, 5A Selection of Sustainability Commission Chairperson and Vice-Chairperson for the 2025-2026 Term
agenda_items.summary: The commissioners will nominate a chairperson and vice-chairperson for the upcoming term ending in March, according to procedures.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about Commissioner Kartunian's intentions for the Chairperson position but received no response, therefore he would not be putting himself forward for that position.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Nominated herself for Chair, citing her tenure, and noted the upcoming term uses similar rules to the mayoral election.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged the nomination.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed seconds aren't required but nominations are.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired about nominations for Vice Chair.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Nominated Vice Chair Pinkerton, noting the long wait.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore
commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged and thanked the previous Chairperson.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Pinkerton
commissioner_comments.comment: Acknowledged that were the Vice Chair when Commissioner Werner was Chair.

agenda_items.title: Five. Action Items, 5B Selection of Ex-Officio Recruitment Ad Hoc Committee
agenda_items.summary: The commission will select an ad hoc committee to undertake the selection and interviews of ex-officio candidates for the 2025-2026 commission term. The application for the positions closed June 15, with interviews to be completed by June 25. Recommendations will be made to the full commission at the July 3 commission meeting. The ad hoc committee needs one voting member.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Inquired if staff is sending out communications to schools.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff
commissioner_comments.comment: Confirmed communications with schools will be sent through various outlets. Staff is making sure communications reach as many people as possible.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Werner
commissioner_comments.comment: Expressed interest in the role.

agenda_items.title: Six. Reports and Information, A. City of Glendale Sustainability Commission 2025-2026 Work Plan
agenda_items.summary: Overview of 2025 Work Plan with highlights focus area of outreach, building systems, urban ecosystems, mobility and land use, and social and governance systems.

commissioner_comments.comment: Mobility and Land use will support Vision Zero plans and EV expansion.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chairperson Bazemore

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff

commissioner_comments.comment: Asks for clarification on if meetings could have someone update on cool centers and see if the City had enough of them. Along with information on resources, and things that may can make recommendations on.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Staff

oral_communications.speaker: Alan Dish
oral_communications.comment: Addressed the Commission, expressing his sentiments regarding Earth Day, which was also his birthday. He mentioned the cutting down of trees in North Central and asked the new mayor to impose stronger measures, possibly declaring a state of emergency, to ban or pause tree cutting. The speaker shared that the mayor responded he could not do it due to the charter. Requested review for the charter committie. Proposed city council and comission to take action. To take action on Ecology. And to stop people destroying them. Stated if someones has issues it would affect his well.
